results.title: How Much Is a $1 Million Umbrella Policy? | Eugene C. Yates Insurance Agency
results.description: Umbrella insurance is extra liability coverage that kicks in when your home, auto, or rental insurance limits are exceeded. For example, if you’re found liable for an accident and your auto policy covers up to $300,000 but the total damages are $900,000, your umbrella policy can pay the remaining $600,000 — protecting your savings, property, and future income.
